text: It shall not be lawful for any person or persons within the District of Columbia to throw any stone or other missile in any street, avenue, alley, road, or highway, or open space, or public square, or inclosure, or to throw any stone or other missile from any place into any street, avenue, road, or highway, alley, open space, public square, or inclosure, under a penalty of not more than $500 for every such offense.
historical:
Prior Codifications

1981 Ed., § 22-1109.

1973 Ed., § 22-1109.

Effect of Amendments

D.C. Law 17-206 substituted "$500" for "five dollars".

Legislative History of Laws

For Law 17-206, see notes following § 22-3751.

DC CODE § 22-1309

Current through December 11, 2012

division.text: Criminal Law and Procedure and Prisoners.
